Detailed Description

Class CellIndex implements a simple n-dimensional integer vector for cell centered variables. Cell indices contain an integer index location in AMR index space and are identical to the AMR indices.

See also:
hier::Index

pdat::CellData

pdat::CellGeometry

pdat::CellIterator

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SAMRAI::pdat::CellIndex::CellIndex ( const tbox::Dimension &  dim  )  [explicit]

The default constructor for a cell index creates an uninitialized index.

Construct a cell index from a regular AMR index.

SAMRAI::pdat::CellIndex::CellIndex ( const CellIndex &  rhs  ) 

The copy constructor creates a cell index equal to the argument.

SAMRAI::pdat::CellIndex::~CellIndex (  ) 

The cell index destructor does nothing interesting.

bool SAMRAI::pdat::CellIndex::operator== ( const CellIndex &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Returns true if two cell index objects are equal. All components must be the same for equality.

bool SAMRAI::pdat::CellIndex::operator!= ( const CellIndex &  rhs  )  const [inline]

Returns true if two cell index objects are not equal. Any of the components may be different for inequality.

Precondition:
getDim() == rhs.getDim()
